wake of the Tucson tragedy, politicians from both sides of the aisle have called for a more civil discourse in our political debate. On CBS's Face the Nation this morning, John McCain ( R-AZ) said, There is a lack of respect in our dialogue.... We shouldn't mistake passion for advocacy. In other words, passion is necessary in this debate that we're having, but we've got to make sure it doesn't spill over into personal attacks and impugning people's character or patriotism. The Defense Department pushed early on "to do what we'd done in Afghanistan"- where a tribal loya jirga had quickly anointed Hamid Karzai as leader. The goal was to move quickly to have an Iraqi face on the leadership in the country, as opposed to a foreign occupation. Mr. Donald Rumsfeld 's early takeaway from NSC meetings was that "the president agreed." Yet Colin Powell 's State Department was adamantly opposed.
